newsitem.title: USA: E.A. Moos cuts back muni effort, 15-17 jobs lost.
newsitem.headline: E.A. Moos cuts back muni effort, 15-17 jobs lost.

text.p: E.A. Moos & Co scaled back its municipal operation, cutting 15 to 17 jobs as of Tuesday, Edward Moos, managing partner of the Summit, N.J.-based firm, said.
While the firm has exited public finance completely, it will continue to engage in sales and trading selectively, Moos said in a telephone interview.

"What we really are doing is exiting the day-to-day municipal bond business," he said. "The municipal bond business day-to-day has become an extremely tough business, and what we are going to do is get down to a hardcore five-to-seven people (operation), and work on special situations."
Municipal new issue underwriting spreads have contracted to "razor" thin levels, while volume has remained light, Moos said, adding that the same is true in public finance.

"In public finance you work months and months on a deal, (and) you find out they want you to do the deal for $3.75," he said, explaining that the firm recently handled a new issue at that price per bond. "It's not worth the risk."
The firm's municipal professionals once numbered 30, he said, but that figure was pared back to 22 a year or so ago.
The remaining five to seven professionals will continue to trade municipals, focusing on "junk" municipals and some similarly rated corporates, as well as other debt, Moos said.
"We will trade the market wherever opportunity arises, whether it's municipal bonds, whether it's government bonds," he said.
E A Moos has always considered itself a trading firm that is unafraid of taking positions, Moos said.

"In fact, what's interesting is one of the biggest customers in the muni bond business -- we are talking one about one of the mega funds -- said to somebody that he was sad to see us dropping out of the business because we provided liquidity," he said, adding that his firm takes more risk than some of its larger competitors.
